In a shaker, combine 1 tablespoon purée with the sugar, lime and mint and mash with a muddler or wooden spoon. Add ice and the rums. Cover and shake vigorously. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with the mango slice.

recipe.name: Pomegranate Daiquiri
recipe.author: John Hyland
recipe.instructions: Pour the ingredients into a shaker filled partly with ice, shake and pour the contents, unstrained, into a rocks glass. Garnish with pomegranate seeds (optional).

recipe.name: The Martini
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Chill a 7-ounce martini glass by filling with ice and water. Fill a professional bartender's glass, or a tall 16-ounce glass, two-thirds full with ice. Add gin and vermouth to the bartender's glass, and stir with a long-necked spoon, keeping the spoon close to the side of the glass as you swirl the ice. Stir until the glass frosts, about 20 seconds. Empty the martini glass, and strain the contents of the bartender's glass into it. Garnish with olive.

recipe.name: Red Lemon
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Mix ingredients together. Serve over ice in an Old-Fashioned glass.

recipe.name: Sparkling Mango
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Pour all liquid ingredients except the Champagne into a mixing glass. Add ice. Shake well for several seconds. Strain into a chilled 5-ounce martini glass, and top to the brim with Champagne. Garnish with a mango slice.

recipe.name: Southside
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice, and shake. Strain into a double Old-Fashioned glass filled with ice, and garnish with a sprig of mint.

recipe.name: Yellow Desert Rose
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Shake liquors with ice; strain and pour into a 5-ounce Collins glass over fresh ice. Fill glass with orange juice. Top off with a drop of grenadine, and garnish with pineapple, orange and lime slices.

recipe.name: Classic Margarita
recipe.author: Frank J. Prial
recipe.instructions: Rub lime slice around outer rim of cocktail glass. Place salt in a dish. Holding glass parallel to dish, coat only the outside with salt. Place glass in refrigerator. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add tequila, Cointreau and lime juice. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

recipe.name: La Paloma
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Pour tequila over ice in a tall highball or Collins glass. Add lime juice. Add Squirt or substitute. Stir and garnish with a slice of lime.

recipe.name: Bottino's Sangria
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Toss the fresh fruit with the lemon zest, sugar and the Recioto or port, and allow the fruit to macerate about an hour. Pour the macerated fruit and its juice into a carafe, and fill with the cold white wine.

recipe.name: Bellini
recipe.author: Nigella Lawson
recipe.instructions: Cut peaches into quarters; discard pits. Hold each quarter over mouth of blender, peel off skin, and drop fruit into blender. Blend until very smooth. Measure out 1 cup of puree and chill. Pour prosecco into a large pitcher. Add chilled peach puree, and stir gently. Serve immediately, before mixture separates.

recipe.name: Red Snapper (Bloody Mary)
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Add the salt, peppers, Worcestershire sauce and lemon juice to a shaker glass. Add ice, vodka and tomato juice. Shake, pour into a highball glass, garnish if you wish, and serve.

recipe.name: The Vamp
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Shake all ingredients, and strain into a wine glass over ice. Garnish with a flamed orange peel.

recipe.name: The Snack Bar Pitcher
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Fill a pitcher (at least 32 ounces) with ice cubes. Crush raspberries; mix with vodka and créme de framboise. Separately, mix grapefruit juice with sparkling wine. Add both mixtures to pitcher, garnish with grapefruit slice and serve.

recipe.name: The Bone
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Serve straight up in a shot glass.

recipe.name: Mango Batido
recipe.author: Jonathan Reynolds
recipe.instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and process until smooth. Pour into a 10-ounce glass and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Silver King
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Place all the ingredients except the soda water and orange slice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until the egg white froths. Pour into a collins glass filled with ice. Top with soda water and garnish with a slice of orange.

recipe.name: Singapore Sling
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Fill a pint glass with ice. Add liquors. Fill nearly to brim with sour mix. Add two splashes of soda plus a dash of lime juice. Pour in a shaker, shake to chill. Return to glass and garnish.

recipe.name: Town Plum
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Shake strained liquid ingredients lightly with ice. Pour into a deep tumbler. Garnish with grapes sliced in half. Stir.

recipe.name: Shanghai Cosmo
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Shake liquid ingredients with ice in a shaker. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with lemon twist.

recipe.name: The Incredible Hulk
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour the first layer, the Hennessy. Pour the second layer, the Hpnotiq. Garnish with three cherries and a sip stick.

recipe.name: Bella Donna
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Rim martini glass with sugar mix. Shake rum, amaretto and sour mix with ice. Strain into glass and serve.

recipe.name: French Martini
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Line martini glass with green apples, with the skins coated with fleur de sel. Mix vodka, Chambord and juice in a shaker with ice; chill and strain into glass. Shake cider till it foams and pour on top.

recipe.name: Hendrick's Gin Gibson
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Chill martini glass. Fill shaker with ice. Pour in gin. Add vermouth. Cover and shake. Put several cocktail onions on a stick and place in chilled glass. Pour cocktail over onions and serve.

recipe.name: Tablatini
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: In medium saucepan, simmer pineapple juice with chopped lemon grass for 15 minutes; let cool. Strain into a jar, and chill. Spear the pineapple wedges with the halved lemon grass stalks. To a pitcher with ice, add pineapple juice, vodka and lime juice. Mix, and strain into 4 chilled martini glasses. Add pineapple-wedge garnish.

recipe.name: The Old-Fashioned
recipe.author: Toby Cecchini
recipe.instructions: In a double-rocks (old-fashioned) glass combine sugar and bitters. Add a couple of teaspoons of hot water, and stir together until sugar is dissolved. Add orange slice, and mull until well mixed. Fill glass with ice, and top with bourbon, stir well. Garnish with lemon peel, twisted to release oil, and cherry.

recipe.name: Sake Sunrise
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Combine dry ingredients in a closeable basket strainer. Immerse in hot sake and steep two hours. Add room-temperature sake, and leave in a cool place (40 to 55 degrees). Infuse (strainer in liquid) for one week. Remove strainer. Serve chilled, shaken with ice. Sake will keep one week, refrigerated.

recipe.name: The Negroni
recipe.author: Toby Cecchini
recipe.instructions: In a shaker filled with ice, combine liquid ingredients. Stir until exterior beads with frost. Strain into chilled cocktail glass; garnish with orange slice, lemon twist or both.

recipe.name: Cuba Libre
recipe.author: Jesse Mckinley
recipe.instructions: Mix the Coca-Cola, rum and gin in a highball glass. Add the bitters, and squeeze in the juice from the lime. Top off with the club soda to add bubbles.

recipe.name: Manhattan
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Shake one or two drops of bitters into a cocktail glass, gently twisting the glass from side to side. Shake out excess, leaving only the residue. Mix bourbon or rye with sweet vermouth in a mixing glass. Add ice. Shake well. Strain contents into cocktail glass. Add cherry or lemon.

recipe.name: Mello Jell-O Shot
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Heat 1 cup Midori with 3 sheets gelatin until dissolved. Cool. Add remaining Midori. For each drink, pour 1 1/2 ounces into a cordial glass. Leave 20 minutes in freezer. Blend 1 cup watermelon juice with 1/2 cup simple syrup and 5 sheets gelatin. Heat until dissolved. Cool. Add remaining watermelon juice and vodka. Pour 1 1/2 ounces to fill each glass. Dried currants soaked in crème de cassis can be added before it sets.

recipe.name: Gin And Tonic
recipe.author: Toby Cecchini
recipe.instructions: Knead 4 of the limes on a cutting board, then juice. Slice used rinds into thin strips. In large pitcher, combine gin and rinds, and muddle for two minutes. Add lime juice, and let stand for five minutes. Fill pitcher halfway with ice. Slowly add tonic. Mix carefully, and pour into tall, chilled highball glasses. Garnish with lime rounds cut from the remaining lime.

recipe.name: Mojito
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Muddle (crush with a pestle) the mint with the lime juice in the bottom of a tall cocktail glass. Add the rum, sugar, crushed ice and soda. Cover and shake, and uncover, serving with a lime wedge.

recipe.name: The Bombardier
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Shake liquid ingredients in a shaker, and pour into a highball glass over ice. Float the mint leaf.

recipe.name: Red-Wine Caipirinha
recipe.author: Jesse Mckinley
recipe.instructions: In a highball glass, muddle the sugar and the lime wedges. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Pour the wine into the glass. Stir well, and serve.

recipe.name: The White Cosmopolitan
recipe.author: Jesse Mckinley
recipe.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with an edible orchid, if desired.

recipe.name: Long Island Iced Tea
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: In a shaker, mix all ingredients except Coke and sour mix; shake, and pour into a 12-ounce glass with ice. Top up glass to 1/2 inch from top with sour mix. Add Coke until drink is the color of weak iced tea. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

recipe.name: Sidecar
recipe.author: William L. Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a glass. For a sugar rim, swipe the rim with a lemon wedge; dab with sugar.

recipe.name: Loco Rumba
recipe.author: Michael Caruso
recipe.instructions: Pour rum over ice in a wineglass. Add Loco Mango; 3 1/2 ounces is about half the bottle. Add grenadine for color. Garnish with wedges of lime or lemon or both. Serve with mariachi music.

recipe.name: Legare Street Punch
recipe.author: Horacio Silva
recipe.description: This recipe is adapted from ''Faithfully Charleston,'' a cookbook released by St. Michael's Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C. It is named for a historic street downtown that honored Solomon Legare, a Huguenot silversmith and Charleston businessman. Regardless of its genteel roots, this punch will be equally at home in a Dixie cup or a silver punch bowl. Either way, drink it over ice, and add an orange slice for good measure.
recipe.instructions: Chill the liquor and the club soda. Blend all the ingredients except the club soda in a punch bowl, stirring until the juices thaw. Just before serving, add the club soda and ice, and garnish with the orange slices. Ladle the mixture into punch cups.

recipe.name: Bemelmans Barter
recipe.author: Warren St. John
recipe.instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the Cognac, Curaçao, pineapple juice and Angostura bitters. Add ice and mix well. Strain drink into a chilled cocktail glass. Lightly dust with nutmeg. Holding the orange twist with tongs, touch a flame to it so the oil in the skin briefly lights. Add to glass and serve.

recipe.name: Truffle Martini
recipe.author: Warren St. John
recipe.instructions: Put Cognac, lime juice and Grand Marnier in shaker with ice. Add two slices of black truffle. Shake well to extract flavor from truffle. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with 5 slices of black truffle, and serve.

recipe.name: Pear Cobbler
recipe.author: Warren St. John
recipe.instructions: Put lemon juice, egg white and confectioners' sugar in cocktail shaker full of ice. Shake or stir vigorously. Add pear liqueur and triple sec. Shake or stir until frothy on top. Pour into chilled martini glass, and float pear slice on top.

recipe.name: Grenadine Punch
recipe.author: William Norwich
recipe.instructions: Combine the tequila, grenadine and lime juice in a bowl and mix. Add the ice and stir until it chills the punch. Serve.

recipe.name: Michelada
recipe.author: Tim Weiner
recipe.description: And just what is in a michelada? In Mexico City, it consists of fresh lime juice, a trinity of Tabasco, Worcestershire and soy sauces, a pinch of black pepper and maybe (or maybe not) a dash of Maggi, the seasoning usually used for soups and stews. This mix makes up two or three fingers' worth of a tall glass. That glass needs ice in it. It needs beer. And it needs drinking. At least, I certainly think it does. It might sound like a hangover recipe, but to me it tastes like malted manna.
recipe.instructions: Squeeze the juice from the lime and reserve. Salt the rim of a highball glass by rubbing it with the lime and dipping it in coarse salt. Fill with ice. Add lime juice, Worcestershire, soy sauce, Tabasco, pepper and Maggi, if desired. Pour in beer, stir and serve, adding more beer as you sip.

recipe.name: Kir Royales
recipe.author: Amanda Hesser
recipe.instructions: Fill the bottom of 6 Champagne glasses with 1/2 tablespoon Cassis. Pop open a bottle of Champagne and divide among the glasses. The color of the drink should be a sunset pink. Garnish with lemon twists.

recipe.name: Junipero Gibson With Pickled Red Onion
recipe.author: Gabrielle Hamilton
recipe.instructions: Place onion in a bowl, and season with salt. Let sit for 10 minutes. Sprinkle vinegar on top, and let sit 10 minutes more. Chill 4 martini glasses in freezer. Fill a spray bottle with 1/4-inch vermouth, and spray the inside of each glass. Or pour a little vermouth in each glass, swirl it, then pour it out, so glass is just lightly coated. Place 3 or 4 pieces of onion in each glass (reserve remaining onion for drinks on another day). Fill a large cocktail shaker with ice, and pour gin over it. Shake vigorously. Strain into glasses. Serve.

recipe.name: Horseradish Vodka
recipe.author: Matt Lee And Ted Lee
recipe.instructions: Peel horseradish, and cut into fine shreds with a vegetable peeler. Uncap vodka, pour off 1 cup and reserve. Using a funnel, add celery seeds and peppercorns to bottle. Add horseradish, then top off bottle with reserved vodka. Let stand at room temperature for 24 hours. Strain vodka through fine sieve to remove celery seeds and fine particles. Chill completely before serving.

recipe.name: Peach Sake
recipe.author: Matt Lee And Ted Lee
recipe.instructions: Cut peaches in half, and remove pits but not skins. Slice thin, and place in large Mason jar or pitcher. Pour sake over the peaches, cover and refrigerate 24 hours. Strain sake through cheesecloth into clean decanter, reserving peaches. Serve immediately, with 3 or 4 peach slices in each glass, or refrigerate sake and peaches in separate containers for later. Infused sake will keep 4 to 5 days in sealed bottle in refrigerator. Peaches will keep 3 days.

recipe.name: Bloodless Mary
recipe.author: Matt Lee And Ted Lee
recipe.instructions: Dip rim of a martini glass in water, then in celery salt to coat. Add chilled vodka. Garnish with celery cut into very fine julienne on a mandoline or with a vegetable peeler. Serve.

recipe.name: Bloody Mary
recipe.author: R. W. Apple Jr.
recipe.instructions: Combine lemon juice, salt, pepper, cayenne and Worcestershire sauce in shaker glass. Add ice cubes, vodka and tomato juice. Shake and strain into highball glass with a few ice cubes. Garnish with lime, and serve.

recipe.name: Bloody Paradise
recipe.author: Amanda Hesser
recipe.instructions: In a shaker, mix together salt, grains of paradise, tomato juice, lime juice, vinegar and vodka. Shake well. Pour over a glass of ice, and grind more grains of paradise over the glass. Garnish with basil leaves.

recipe.name: The Bartender Sambonn (Sam) Lek's Millennium Mender
recipe.author: Molly O'Neill
recipe.instructions: In a bar shaker, combine all the ingredients and shake vigorously. Strain into a highball glass and serve.

recipe.name: The Bartender Sambonn (Sam) Lek's Rusty's Return
recipe.author: Molly O'Neill
recipe.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until frothy.

recipe.name: Kir Royale 38
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Pour the cognac and Grand Marnier into the bottom of a champagne flute. Fill glass with champagne and garnish with the orange slice.

recipe.name: Juniperotivo
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: In mixing glass, using a spoon, crush 2 mint leaves in the simple syrup, and add gin, lime juice and pomegranate syrup. Pour into ice-filled shaker. Shake well, and strain into chilled cocktail glass. To garnish, float the 2 remaining mint leaves on surface of drink.

recipe.name: Watermelon Champagne
recipe.author: Florence Fabricant
recipe.instructions: Place watermelon and sugar in a blender, and process until smooth. Half-fill eight Champagne flutes with the watermelon mixture. Slowly pour the Champagne into each flute to fill it. Serve at once.

recipe.name: Watermelon-Strawberry Slush
recipe.author: Florence Fabricant
recipe.instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender, and process until smooth. Pour into 2 goblets, and serve.

recipe.name: The Original Mix Classic Bloody Mary (a k a the Red Snapper)
recipe.author: Florence Fabricant
recipe.instructions: Place Worcestershire sauce, peppers, salt and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker or a wide-mouth jar. Add ice, vodka and tomato juice. Shake well. Pour into a highball glass or goblet. Garnish with lime, and serve.

recipe.name: Rainbow Julep
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Pour the Apry into a highball glass, add 3 or 4 small mint leaves and muddle. Add the bourbon and fill glass with crushed ice. Stir until frost forms on outside of glass, and garnish with 3 or 4 mint sprigs. Serve with two straws.

recipe.name: Citrus Julep
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Scrub the fruit, and use a zester or sharp knife to scrape slivers of rind from each. Set the fruit aside. Combine sugar and water in a saucepan, and bring to a quick boil. Add zest, turn heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes. Turn off heat, and allow to cool. Put mint leaves in a quart jar or crock, and use the back of a wooden spoon to bruise them slightly, releasing the fragrance. Pour syrup, including the zest, over the leaves, and steep for 1 hour. Juice the lime, orange and lemon, and strain into a pitcher. Pour the mint syrup through the strainer as well, using the back of the spoon to press the captured mint leaves and zest to extract remaining juices. For each person, fill an 8-ounce glass or julep cup with ice. Pour 3 ounces of bourbon into each, then top off with the mint syrup. Serve with short straws and a garnish of mint.

recipe.name: Vodka Tonic With Mint
recipe.author: Elaine Louie
recipe.instructions: Fill an 8-ounce glass with ice cubes, add all ingredients and stir gently, taking care not to bruise mint leaves.

recipe.name: Normandie Tea
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: In a pan, warm the Calvados. In a tall pedestal mug, mix the Calvados with the sugar. Ignite with a match and let burn for 10 seconds. Add tea and garnish with cinnamon stick.

recipe.name: Venetian Sunset
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Pour ingredients into an ice-filled shaker, shake, and strain into a martini glass.

recipe.name: Cafe Brulot
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: In a pan, warm the Cognac. In a tall pedestal mug, mix the Cognac and the sugar. Ignite with a match, and let burn for 10 seconds. Add coffee and top with cream. Affix clove to orange or lemon zest by pushing it through the skin. Add lemon and orange zests, cinnamon stick and candied orange peel.

recipe.name: Southern Belle
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Pour ingredients into an ice-filled shaker, shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.

recipe.name: Bush's Blarney
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Mix whisky, Irish mist, lemon juice and bitters, and serve on the rocks or straight up. Garnish with lemon rind.

recipe.name: Royal Hawaiian
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Pour ingredients into an ice-filled shaker, shake, then strain into a cocktail glass.

recipe.name: Armagnac Aperitif
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Pour wine in a wine glass, add Armagnac, stir, and garnish with prune.

recipe.name: Clinton's Folly
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Mix bourbon, Southern Comfort, creme de cacao and creme de banane. Serve on the rocks or straight up.

recipe.name: Caliente Lemonade
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: In a saucepan, mix water, lemon juice, orange juice, sugar and rum. Heat to just below boiling point. Pour into mugs and garnish with slices of lemon or orange, studded with cloves.

recipe.name: Peanut-Butter Batida
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Blend ingredients in an ice-filled blender. Pour into a parfait glass.

recipe.name: Washington Cocktail
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Mix rum, lemon juice, Cointreau, gin and orange juice, and serve on the rocks. Garnish with cherry.

recipe.name: Caipiruva
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: In a shaker, muddle the grapes and sugar. Add ice and cachaca, and shake lightly. Pour into a Pilsener glass.

recipe.name: Americano
recipe.author: William Grimes
recipe.instructions: Pour 1 ounce of the Campari and 1/2 ounce of the vermouth into each of two short cocktail glasses filled with ice. Top up with club soda and stir. Garnish each with a twist of lemon.

recipe.name: Hot Wine
recipe.author: Jacques Pepin
recipe.instructions: Place the wine in a saucepan with the sugar and heat the mixture slowly until just below a boil. Meanwhile, squeeze a wedge of lemon into each of six mugs and drop the wedges into the mugs. Divide the wine among the mugs and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Strawberry Sparkler
recipe.author: Florence Fabricant
recipe.instructions: Rinse the strawberries. Reserve eight attractive medium size ones. Hull and chop the rest. Mix the chopped strawberries with the liquor, then divide among eight tall champagne glasses. Pour the sparkling wine into each glass, pouring a little in at first and allowing the foam to subside before adding the rest. Decorate each glass with one of the reserved strawberries by forcing it partway down on the rim of the glass. Serve at once.

recipe.name: Bellini Coupe
recipe.author: Florence Fabricant
recipe.instructions: Bring a pot of water to a boil and dip the peaches in it for 30 seconds. Rinse the peaches in cold water, then peel. Remove the pits and place the pits in a bowl. Combine the lemon juice, orange juice and schnapps and add to the bowl. Slice the peaches and place in the bowl, taking care that the slices are completely moistened with the juice and schnapps mixture. Cover by placing a sheet of plastic wrap directly onto the surface of the peaches and refrigerate for two hours. Adding the peach pit just enhances the flavor a bit. To serve divide the peach slices and the juice among four large stemmed goblets. Carefully pour the sparkling wine over the peach slices, pouring slowly because the wine will foam up. Serve at once. When guests have finished eating the peaches, more of the wine can be added to the goblets for sipping.

recipe.name: Van Cortlandt Punch
recipe.author: Suzanne M. Charle
recipe.description: Here’s a bit of New York City history for you: This punch was originally served in 1710 at the inauguration of Jacobus Van Cortlandt, one of the last old Dutch politicians and the city’s 30th mayor (he returned to office in 1719 as the city’s 33rd.) The recipe was brought back to light by Richard Ferrugio, who catered the inaugural of Mayor Edward I. Koch in 1986. Mayor Van Cortlandt's swearing-in, Walt Whitman wrote, was a full-day affair “much in keeping with the celebrations of the Old Netherlands.” He added: “Very popular were all the hot punches, seasoned and tempted with brandy.” This is the perfect libation for a winter inaugural party, when you can watch a ceremony that lends a little class to the blood sport of politics.
recipe.instructions: Place the cinnamon sticks, cloves and cardamom pods in a cheesecloth bag and tie securely. Heat the cider with spices until piping hot. When ready to serve, add the apple brandy, and garnish with orange slices and apple wedges.
